page.title: 18Shopping in Alrewas & Barton
page.content: There are no shops in Wychnor, but Alrewas has a variety of shops along Main Street. Food can be bought at the Post Office, Dickenson's Stores, the Co-op, the Tudor Bread & Cake shop or Coates the butcher. There is a Nu-mark Pharmacy, a fish and chip shop, a newsagents, a bank and an antique shop. People tend to shop in one of the nearby large towns' supermarkets and only buy locally if necessary. Older people and women at home are the main customers. Main Street is much quieter now since a by-pass was opened in 1984. The shopping area in Barton is a small housing estate service. There is a newsagent, a grocer, a discount hardware store, a hairdresser and a Chinese take away. The main shops are elsewhere in the village and are changing quickly.
